Key Match Events: Lassine Sinayoko scored the second goal for Mali in the 1st half
Bertrand Traore scored a penalty for Burkina Faso in the 2nd half
Post-Match Reflections: Lassine Sinayoko expressed his satisfaction with the victory while acknowledging more work ahead
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in 36 degrees Celsius heat
Others: Mali reached the quarter-finals for the first time since 2013
Mali made six changes from the side that fought a 0-0 draw with Namibia to top Group E
Burkina Faso changed four of the side beaten 2-0 by Angola with out-of-favour Aston Villa forward Traore the captain
This was only the second Cup of Nations meeting between the west African neighbours with Mali winning a group match 3-1 in Tunisia 20 years ago
